p: Similarly, one of the primary vectors of RVFV is A. vexans, which also exists as a species complex including subspecies vexans and arabiensis; for example, A. vexans arabiensis is an important vector in Senegal and Saudi Arabia. A. vexans occurs also in parts of western Europe 44, 45 and in a recent study involving MEZE in Epping Forest was found to cause nuisance biting close to the London Olympics village site. 46 Should this be a concern, and should we assess its taxonomy and vector competence?
